subject: Re: [junit] awkward mock objects
msgSnippet: ... George, I d appreciate your AbstractMockResultSet class very much. Maybe you can add it to the files section of the yahoogroup as well. BTW, A pattern I
messageBody:
> "Dinwiddie, George" wrote:
>
> Speaking of mock objects, I needed to test some objects that
> initialized themselves from a JDBC ResultSet. Rather than generate a
> test table and stuff data into it, I decided to create a
> MockResultSet. Well, ResultSet is an interface with a LOT of
> methods. What a boring chore this turned out to be. In the end, I
> created an AbstractMockResultSet class that throws an SQLException for
> every method. If anyone needs such a thing, let me know and it could
> save you a lot of typing.
>
> - George

George,

I'd appreciate your AbstractMockResultSet class very much. Maybe you can
add it to the files section of the yahoogroup as well. BTW, A pattern I
encountered in other people's mock classes is to throw a
NotImplementedException (a RuntimeException) instead of a declared
exception like SQLException.

regards,
Johannes Link
